summary: The 'Justice for Vaccine Injured Veterans Act of 2025' amends Title 38 of the United States Code to provide a presumption of service-connection for certain diseases (myocarditis, pericarditis, thrombosis with thrombocytopenia syndrome, Guillian-Barre Syndrome, and any other disease deemed warranted by the Secretary) associated with the COVID-19 vaccine that manifest in veterans who received the vaccine between August 24, 2021, and January 10, 2023. The bill mandates the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to report on claims related to these diseases and make these reports public. The bill also defines 'COVID-19 vaccine'.
